Measure the drink in your bar by measuring the height from the bottom of the bottle in millimeters and entering it into the application. The application calculates the amount of drink in the bottle expressed in liters.

It is possible to search drinks by name, but it is even easier and faster to just scan the bar code for drinks with a mobile phone camera.

There are over 1300 different bottles in the database and they are increasing every day and new bottle shapes are being introduced.
Namely, each bottle has a different shape and thus the measured height gives a different actual amount of drink in the bottle.
Certilia mobile vam omogućava elektroničku identifikaciju i potpisivanje dokumenata sa pravnom snagom jednakom vlastoručnom potpisu.

Jenz is a mobile app that builds a more connected, engaged, and productive workforce, even during the home-office mode.


The app deals with employee engagement, communication, and feedback. It helps reduce turnover, improves company culture, and the feeling of connectedness which ultimately increases happiness, productivity and profits.


The best way to describe Jenz is to say it's a "closed social network" where you post literally anything that your employees will find meaningful and then immediately get feedback if needed. It gives employees everything they need in a simple, easy-to-use interface increasing engagement, productivity, and collaboration across the enterprise. It is the central location employees go-to for fast and relevant access to all the information they need every day to communicate, collaborate, and learn.


"Jenz is the perfect solution for today's home-office mode. It has a look and feel of Instagram or Twitter, it's super easy to use, and the onboarding time is minimal." — Deloitte


The app has 8 basic features and serves as one single social network within the company. Anything important or relevant gets posted in Jenz, so employees can scan the app for just 1 minute per day and stay informed and connected.

Company News - To solve the problem of not reaching out to everyone with important company information and announcements, and avoiding sending long and boring emails, we developed a Story newsfeed for official company news. To make news more attractive and easy to absorb, the format of each story includes one or more pictures or a video. After all, a picture is worth a thousand words, and video a million, right?
Fun Tweet - Another section of story newsfeed is fun stories, where everyone can post fun or interesting content, in the same format as previous ones. Jenz UI reminds of a social network, so users feel more relaxed, engaged, and comfortable to post, like, and comment on stories.
People Directory - Here you can reach out to anyone easily, call them or send them an email just by searching them by their name or department. New employees are highlighted, which turns out as a great conversation starter. Every employee has a profile with a picture, department, job title, and a short bio.
Away Status - Since we are fully agile and support remote work, reporting absence is common and crucial, but often out-of-office emails get unnoticed. Marking away status through Jenz as remote, sick, holiday, or business trip, gives information not only to HR and team leads but also to other coworkers.
Kudos & Recognition - Reward, recognition, and feedback are essential for promoting good company culture and growth. Everyone appreciates their work being acknowledged. By one click on a colleague's name, and voluntary explanation, people can kudos each other, which goes directly to the chosen coworker, their team lead, and HR.
Employee Feedback - Shoutbox gives employees a chance to write anything they wish, completely anonymously, and pick which department that message goes. This grants every person a voice! It could be a complaint, suggestion, advice, or quick info about something not working in the office. Easy, but most of all, efficient!
Anonymous Surveys - Find out what people think in a snap! Multiple forms of questions, like rating scale, multiple-choice, and yes/no questions, are great for collecting unbiased data, and for better insight on employees' feelings and attitudes, there are open-ended questions. We created polls mostly because of our need to get answers to short and quick surveys, fast and easy.

Build a culture of happy, proud and motivated employees
Let's Jenz ;-)
